```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(warning = F, results = T, message = T)
loadPkg = function(x) { if (!require(x,character.only=T, quietly =T)) { install.packages(x,dep=T,repos="http://cran.us.r-project.org"); if(!require(x,character.only=T)) stop("Package not found") } }
```

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}

census <- read.csv(file = 'acs2015updated.csv')

```

```{r}
census2 <- subset(census, INTPTLONG > -150 & INTPTLONG < -50 & INTPTLAT > 24 & INTPTLAT < 50) 
str(census2)
```




```{r}

loadPkg("ggplot2")
ggplot(census2, aes( x= INTPTLONG, y = INTPTLAT, color = Hispanic)) + 
  geom_point(size=0.005) + scale_color_gradient(low="orange", high="red") +
  labs (title="Scatter Plot: IncomePerCap",
        x=" Latitude",
        y = "Longitude")

```

```{r}


hist(census2$sodium, 
        col = "green",
        main = "Histogram: Sodium",
        xlab = "Amount of sodium per 100 grams in the sample")

ggplot(census2, aes( x= Professional, y = IncomePerCap, color = Asian)) + 
  geom_point(size=0.1) +
  labs (title="Scatter Plot",
        x="Construction",
        y = "IncomePerCap")

```
